qas.question: The Dominican Order was also greatly helped by what German friar?
Albert Magnus was also known as "Albert the what"?
What was a discipline of Albert the Great?
Who did Albert Magnus introduce to Dominican Order students?
Who helped Albert Magnus bring Aristotelian curriculum to Dominican classrooms?
Who did not greatly help the Dominican Order?
What was Albert Magnus not also known as "Albert the what?

plausible_answers.text: scientist, philosopher, astrologer, theologian, spiritual writer, ecumenist, and diplomat

qas.question: What was not a discipline of Albert the Great?
Whose curriculum did Albert not mold?
Who did Albert Magnus not introduce to Dominican Order students?

context: Another who contributed significantly to the spirituality of the order is <a0_0><b5_0>Albertus Magnus<b5_0/><a0_0/>, the only person of the period to be given the appellation "<a1_0><b6_0>Great<b6_0/><a1_0/>". His influence on the brotherhood permeated nearly every aspect of Dominican life. Albert was a <b7_0>scientist, philosopher, astrologer, theologian, spiritual writer, <a2_0>ecumenist<a2_0/>, and diplomat<b7_0/>. Under the auspices of Humbert of Romans, Albert molded the curriculum of studies for all <b8_0>Dominican students<b8_0/>, introduced <a3_0><b9_0>Aristotle<b9_0/><a3_0/> to the classroom and probed the work of Neoplatonists, such as Plotinus. Indeed, it was the thirty years of work done by <a4_0>Thomas Aquinas<a4_0/> and himself (1245–1274) that allowed for the inclusion of Aristotelian study in the curriculum of Dominican schools.
